com.sudoplay.axion.stream

Class AxionInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.FilterInputStream
        • com.sudoplay.axion.stream.AxionInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class AxionInputStream
extends java.io.FilterInputStream
    This is basically a DataInputStream modified to support a custom CharacterEncoder.
    Author:
    Jason Taylor

      • readBoolean

        public boolean readBoolean()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.io.EOFException
        Reads the next byte and returns true if non-zero, false otherwise.

        The returned value is:
        b != 0

        Returns:
        true or false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.EOFException

      • readFully

        public void readFully(byte[] b)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.io.EOFException
        Reads a sequence of bytes equal to the length of the byte array given. The bytes read are stored in the byte array given.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to store the read bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.EOFException

      • readFully

        public void readFully(byte[] b,
             int off,
             int len)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.io.EOFException
        Reads a sequence of bytes and stores them in the byte array given.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to store the read bytes
        off - the offset to start reading
        len - the number of bytes to read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.EOFException

      • readInt

        public int readInt()
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.io.EOFException
        Reads and returns the next four bytes interpreted as an integer.

        The returned value is:
        ((b1 << 24) + (b2 << 16) + (b3 << 8) + (b4 << 0))

        Returns:
        the next four bytes interpreted as an integer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.EOFException

      • readLong

        public long readLong()
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.io.EOFException
        Reads and returns the next eight bytes interpreted as a long.

        The returned value is: 

         
 (((long)(a & 0xff) << 56) |
  ((long)(b & 0xff) << 48) |
  ((long)(c & 0xff) << 40) |
  ((long)(d & 0xff) << 32) |
  ((long)(e & 0xff) << 24) |
  ((long)(f & 0xff) << 16) |
  ((long)(g & 0xff) <<  8) |
  ((long)(h & 0xff)))

        Returns:
        the next eight bytes interpreted as a long
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.EOFException

      • readShort

        public short readShort()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.io.EOFException
        Reads and returns the next two bytes interpreted as a short.

        The returned value is:
        ((b1 << 8) + (b2 << 0))

        Returns:
        the next two bytes interpreted as a short
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.EOFException

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.io.EOFException
        Reads and returns the next series of bytes interpreted as a string by the CharacterEncoder set in the constructor, AxionInputStream(InputStream, CharacterEncoder).
        Returns:
        the next series of bytes interpreted as a string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.EOFException
